intro: Tinopsis phellocarpa, commonly known as the silverleaf tinplant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Phyllosteryaceae and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are succulent, which helps it store water, and it produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Tinopsis phellocarpa is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
